results.name: a(n) = gcd(A056239(n), A324888(n)) = gcd(A001222(A108951(n)), A001222(A324886(n))).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
Index entries for sequences related to primorial numbers
mathematica: With[{b = MixedRadix[Reverse@ Prime@ Range@ 500]}, Array[GCD @@ PrimeOmega@ {#, Function[k, Times @@ Power @@@ # &@ Transpose@ {Prime@ Range@ Length@ k, Reverse@ k}]@ IntegerDigits[#, b]} &@ Apply[Times, Map[#1^#2 & @@ # &, FactorInteger[#] /. {p_, e_} /; e > 0 :> {Times @@ Prime@ Range@ PrimePi@ p, e}]] &, 105]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 18 2019 *)
program: A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 18 2019
